c74f","dweb:/ipfs/QmbZaJyXdpsYGykVhHH9qpVGQg9DGCxE2QufbCUy3daTgq"]},"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/ERC20Detailed.sol":{"keccak256":"0x4a3a810b7ebe742e897e1fd428b3eeed2196d3acea58eaf9c566ed10d545d2ed","urls":["bzz-raw://28d03f328e19e4099d5013de0649afaeaabac1a614e130767ab1cb4aca9775b6","dweb:/ipfs/Qmb9iW7yNuYehB2NfhRMs9TakqbLVQhBhmGMkaDZ5g1Eb4"]},"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol":{"keccak256":"0xe5bb0f57cff3e299f360052ba50f1ea0fff046df2be070b6943e0e3c3fdad8a9","urls":["bzz-raw://59fd025151435da35faa8093a5c7a17de02de9d08ad27275c5cdf05050820d91","dweb:/ipfs/QmQMvwEcPhoRXzbXyrdoeRtvLoifUW9Qh7Luho7bmUPRkc"]},"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/SafeERC20.sol":{"keccak256":"0x6f2c9955d65c522b80f4b8792f076512d2df947d2112cbc4d98a4781ed42ede2","urls":["bzz-raw://7d8ec81683520c06baeef3f7e06cd82bd6fd5fa611f26857f475f6c829540aff","dweb:/ipfs/QmTDkFzKnrpiV1UKnSoiZAHPuguWzokrr4pFbSPvyaSo56"]},"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/Address.sol":{"keccak256":"0x1a8e5072509c5ea7365eb1d48030b9be865140c8fb779968da0a459a0e174a11","urls":["bzz-raw://03335b7b07c7c8c8d613cfdd8ec39a0b5ec133ee510bf2fe6cc5a496767bef4b","dweb:/ipfs/Qmebp4nzPja645c9yXSdJkGq96oU3am3LUnG2K3R7XxyKf"]}},"version":1}

nodes.documentation:
The goal of this strategy is to take a stable asset (DAI, USDC, USDT), turn it into ycrv using
the curve mechanisms, and supply ycrv into the ycrv vault. The ycrv vault will likely not have
a reward token distribution pool to avoid double dipping. All the calls to functions from this
strategy will be routed to the controller which should then call the respective methods on the
ycrv vault. This strategy will not be liquidating any yield crops (CRV), because the strategy
of the ycrv vault will do that for us.
nodes.name: CRVStrategyStable

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "The sender has to be the controller, governance, or vault"

arguments.value: The sender has to be the controller, governance, or vault

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "The sender has to be the controller, governance, or vault"

nodes.documentation: Uses the Curve protocol to convert the underlying asset into yAsset and then to yCRV.
nodes.name: yCurveFromUnderlying

nodes.documentation:
Uses the Curve protocol to convert the yCRV back into the underlying asset. If it cannot acquire
the limit amount, it will acquire the maximum it can.
nodes.name: yCurveToUnderlying

nodes.documentation:
Withdraws an underlying asset from the strategy to the vault in the specified amount by asking
the yCRV vault for yCRV (currently all of it), and then removing imbalanced liquidity from
the Curve protocol. The rest is deposited back to the yCRV vault. If the amount requested cannot
be obtained, the method will get as much as we have.
nodes.name: withdrawToVault

nodes.documentation:
Withdraws all assets from the vault. We ask the yCRV vault to give us our entire yCRV balance
and then convert it to the underlying asset using the Curve protocol.
nodes.name: withdrawAllToVault

nodes.documentation: Invests all underlying assets into our yCRV vault.
nodes.name: investAllUnderlying

nodes.documentation:
The hard work only invests all underlying assets, and then tells the controller to call hard
work on the yCRV vault.
nodes.name: doHardWork

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "token is defined as not salvageable"

arguments.value: token is defined as not salvageable

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "token is defined as not salvageable"

nodes.documentation:
Salvages a token. We cannot salvage the shares in the yCRV pool, yCRV tokens, or underlying
assets.
nodes.name: salvage

nodes.documentation:
Returns the underlying invested balance. This is the amount of yCRV that we are entitled to
from the yCRV vault (based on the number of shares we currently have), converted to the
underlying assets by the Curve protocol, plus the current balance of the underlying assets.
nodes.name: investedUnderlyingBalance

nodes.documentation: Returns the value of yCRV in underlying token accounting for slippage and fees.
nodes.name: yTokenValueFromYCrv

nodes.documentation: Returns the value of yCRV in y-token (e.g., yCRV -> yDai) accounting for slippage and fees.
nodes.name: underlyingValueFromYCrv

nodes.documentation: Returns the value of the underlying token in yToken
nodes.name: yTokenValueFromUnderlying

nodes.documentation: Wraps the coin amount in the array for interacting with the Curve protocol
nodes.name: wrapCoinAmount

nodes.documentation: Replaces the price convertor
nodes.name: setConvertor

doHardWork().notice: The hard work only invests all underlying assets, and then tells the controller to call hard work on the yCRV vault.

investedUnderlyingBalance().notice: Returns the underlying invested balance. This is the amount of yCRV that we are entitled to from the yCRV vault (based on the number of shares we currently have), converted to the underlying assets by the Curve protocol, plus the current balance of the underlying assets.

The rest is deposited back to the yCRV vault. If the amount requested cannot be obtained, the method will get as much as we have.

userdoc.notice: The goal of this strategy is to take a stable asset (DAI, USDC, USDT), turn it into ycrv using the curve mechanisms, and supply ycrv into the ycrv vault. The ycrv vault will likely not have a reward token distribution pool to avoid double dipping. All the calls to functions from this strategy will be routed to the controller which should then call the respective methods on the ycrv vault. This strategy will not be liquidating any yield crops (CRV), because the strategy of the ycrv vault will do that for us.
